column1: Interview I'm gonna ask you questions about some of the stories that you can you tell me what did you think about the use of VR in the different scenarios that you watch and what parts stood out to you?
I feel like a good way to school. Because you could go back without time and like, you can see it, in realize, instead of... you have to see one side.
What kinds of issues or problems you can see VR could create for families and for children's?
Children...It was probably like... to have as much family time and be more on the VR headset. I feel like one downside of VR people.
Who should decide which VR experiences are suitable for children and what should creators keep in mind when they're designing for VR for kids and families?
I would say not need to be too realistic becuase it would scare some people. Like too realistic but at the same time, make it like, feels like rure bear.
Anything else you want to share? No? Amazing. Thank you so much for your help.
